content: Why : (This is a harder version of community puzzle “Brackets, extreme edition”. You may want to complete that one first.) ???

So basically this puzzle has the same test cases and validators as the Enhanced edition? That'll be duplication. (This is different from the Ultimate edition where although the cases are the same the output requirement is different.)

I understand the intention may be to let players solve this one first and later find that the written code is unable to solve the harder one, but still...

Also, as this puzzle hasn't been published yet, the Enhanced edition puzzle statement should not include a reference to this puzzle yet.

This is the common easier ancestor to Brackets Enhanced and Brackets Ultimate.

This is old stuff that wasn't appropriate for the platform at the time. But as was suggested in the chat, with the recent difficulty setting change, it might find its place now.

It is very much more brute-forceable.

(sorry about the puzzle confusion while discussing on the chat---it's late here)

Reminder: https://imgur.com/a/27wV9

As i explained in the other comment, at the time the puzzles were approved out of order, which led to the clunky situation we have now.

Of course the tests are the same! In the grand scheme, this one is a superset of extreme, enhanced is a superset of this one, and impossible (still in draft) is a superset of enhanced.

Please abstract away from the order of publication if you can't temporarily forget the smart way to solve it. This one admits simpler solutions, and is targeted at a much more beginner audience, in an explicitly easy section, now it exists.

(You solved enhanced. You're no beginner ;-)
